author: cnbc.com
title: Dermira reports 4Q loss
text:
MENLO PARK, Calif. (AP) _ Dermira Inc. (DERM) on Thursday reported a loss of $56 million in its fourth quarter.
The Menlo Park, California-based company said it had a loss of $1.34 per share.
The skin condition drug developer posted revenue of $1.3 million in the period.
For the year, the company reported that its loss widened to $303.3 million, or $7.48 per share. Revenue was reported as $4.5 million.
Dermira shares have dropped almost 4 percent since the beginning of the year. The stock has dropped 20 percent in the last 12 months.
